excerpt: Medieval stone fortress & former prison built in 1542, offering an archaeological museum & tours.
detail_description: The Priamar Fortress, a medieval stone fortress and former prison constructed in 1542, is a significant historical site in Savona. It now houses the Archaeological Museum of Savona and offers guided tours. The fortress overlooks the sea and provides stunning views of the coastline and the city. Inside, visitors can explore the Sandro Pertini and Renata Cuneo Museum, showcasing artistic collections donated by prominent Savona citizens.
name: Priamar Fortress
address: Corso Giuseppe Mazzini, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: Savona, a charming seafront resort nestled between Savona and Imperia, is often overlooked by British travelers. Despite its picturesque location, it remains relatively unknown even among Italophiles.
name: Savona
address: 17100 Province of Savona, Italy

detail_description: When visiting Savona, a must-see attraction is La Torretta - Torre Leon Pancaldo. This medieval tower, also known as Torre della Quarda, stands tall at 23 meters and dates back to the 14th century. Named after the renowned explorer Leon Pancaldo, it holds historical significance as one of the city's symbols. The tower offers a glimpse into Savona's past and its ties to explorers like Magellan and Columbus.
name: La Torretta - Torre Leon Pancaldo
address: Piazza Leon Pancaldo, 1, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: Via Pietro Paleocapa is the bustling main street of Savona, offering a glimpse into the city's 19th-century charm. It serves as a popular shopping destination and is lined with architectural marvels such as the Art Nouveau facade of Palazzo dei Pavoni and the Baroque Church of San Giovanni Battista. Strolling along this vibrant thoroughfare provides an opportunity to soak in both historical and contemporary elements of Savona's urban landscape.
name: Via Pietro Paleocapa
address: 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: The All About Apple Museum is a must-see for Apple enthusiasts, boasting the world's most extensive private collection of Apple products. Visitors can immerse themselves in the history of Apple and even interact with functioning vintage computers, including the iconic Apple 3. The museum offers a unique experience for both technology enthusiasts and those interested in computer history. Located conveniently near the cruise terminal, it provides an enjoyable way to spend an hour or more exploring this remarkable collection.
name: All About Apple Museum
address: P.za Fabrizio De André, 12r/14r, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

excerpt: The history of ceramic art is detailed in exhibits at this stately museum in a medieval building.
detail_description: The Museo della Ceramica di Savona is a stately museum housed in a medieval building that offers an intricate history of ceramic art through various exhibits. The collection features mostly terracotta ceramics from the XIV-XVII centuries, with cobalt and cobalt-ochre designs used for noble kitchenware. Additionally, there are some unique pieces of wall paintings and marble frescos on canvas.
name: Museo della Ceramica di Savona
address: Palazzo Monte di Pietà, Via Ambrogio Aonzo, 9, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

name: Zinola
address: 17100 Province of Savona, Italy

detail_description: Cappella Sistina in Savona is a stunning attraction that has undergone renovation in the Rococo style, featuring ornate decorations and a ceiling painted by Paolo Geralamo Brusco. The carved wooden choir seats and elegant cloister garden are also worth marveling at. Visitors have found the tour to be well worth the small charge, making it a must-visit for those interested in beautiful architecture and an enriching atmosphere.
name: Cappella Sistina
address: Piazza del Duomo, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: Torre Brandale stands proudly in the heart of Savona, offering a glimpse into the city's rich history. This medieval tower, constructed around the 11th century, was once one of the most significant structures in Savona. Over time, it underwent various modifications after being acquired by the municipality in the early 14th century; notably, its bell was added and its height reduced by over 20 meters.
name: Torre Brandale
address: Piazza del Brandale, 2r, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

excerpt: Collections of Renaissance paintings, icons & ceramics, housed in the 16th-century Palazzo Gavotti.
detail_description: The Pinacoteca Civica, housed in the historic Palazzo Gavotti, is a hidden gem showcasing a rich collection of Renaissance paintings, sculptures, and ceramics. This museum is considered one of the most important in Liguria and features masterpieces known worldwide. The 16th-century palazzo also hosts the Museo della Ceramica, which displays an impressive collection representing a local tradition spanning over six centuries.
name: Pinacoteca Civica
address: 2 Piazza Gilbert Chabrol Savona, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

name: Palazzo Delle Piane
address: Corso Italia, 31, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

excerpt: Port servicing cruise ships as well as the home port of the major cruise line, Costa Cruises.
detail_description: The Port of Savona, also known as Porto di Savona in Italian, is a bustling port in Italy that serves as a major ferry terminal and home port for Costa Cruises. Nestled next to the historic center of Savona, the port offers stunning views of the city's landmarks, including the fish market and charming alfresco cafes.
name: Port of Savona
address: Via Antonio Baglietto, 26, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

name: Palazzo dei Pavoni
address: Via Pietro Paleocapa, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: In September 2021, Villa Cambiaso showcased a magnificent art exhibition dedicated to Giorgio Faletti. Visitors had the privilege of accessing top-notch art guides without paying any fee. This exceptional exhibition space gathered a group of passionate artists who adored their own creations and held great reverence for Savona's rich culture. The experience was truly inspiring, as it compelled attendees to delve deeper into the diverse works on display.
name: Villa Cambiaso
address: Via Torino, 10, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

excerpt: Albisola Superiore is a comune in the Province of Savona in the Italian region Liguria, located about 35 kilometres southwest of Genoa and about 5 kilometres northeast of Savona. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Albisola Superiore, a charming comune in the Province of Savona, is nestled in the picturesque Italian region of Liguria. Situated approximately 35 kilometers southwest of Genoa and just 5 kilometers northeast of Savona, this idyllic destination offers a perfect blend of natural beauty and rich history for visitors to explore.
name: Albisola Superiore
address: 17011 Province of Savona, Italy

name: La Torretta
address: Via Santorre di Santarosa, 6, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

excerpt: Lively, scenic cove beach offering an eatery & a popular destination for swimming & sunning.
detail_description: Bagni Mauro is a picturesque cove beach that boasts a vibrant atmosphere and stunning ocean views. It offers visitors the chance to enjoy swimming and sunbathing amid its pebbly shores. The beach also features an eatery where guests can indulge in delectable cuisine while taking in the scenic surroundings. Overall, Bagni Mauro is an ideal destination for those seeking a lively yet relaxing beach experience on their next vacation.
name: Bagni Mauro
address: Italy

detail_description: Santuario Di Nostra Signora Di Misericordia is a marian sanctuary located in the Santuario area of Savona. It houses significant baroque works by Borgianni, Domenichino, and Bernardo Castello, as well as an altar by Bernini. The basilica was built on the site where Our Lady of Mercy appeared to Antonio Botta in 1536.
name: Santuario Di Nostra Signora Di Misericordia
address: Piazza Santuario, 17100 Santuario SV, Italy

detail_description: The Oratorio del Cristo Risorto, managed by the Confraternities in Savona, is a highly frequented church that houses valuable artistic treasures. Among these are the two Processional Casse of Good Friday, one created by Brilla and the other by Maragliano. Atop it all stands the statue of the Risen Christ, which lends its name to the Brotherhood responsible for its safekeeping.
name: Oratorio del Cristo Risorto
address: Via Pia, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: The lido Bagni S.Antonio is characterized by its welcoming and relaxed atmosphere. The price for accommodation, which includes three beds and a private bathroom, amounts to 33 euros. Additionally, guests are provided with an additional shaded area for their convenience. Although the pasta served at the lido is enjoyable, some visitors have noted that the portion size could be larger. Overall, it is considered a pleasant destination for a vacation experience.
name: Bagni S.Antonio
address: Via Nizza, 3/B, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: The Museo D'Arte Sandro Pertini e Renata Cuneo is part of the Priamar Historical Complex and Palazzo della Loggia. Visitors find it absurd that such an important public asset has restricted visiting hours, only open on three working days with limited hours. Despite this, the museum is described as interesting, showcasing works that provide insight into Sandro Pertini's character.
name: Museo Sandro Pertini e Renata Cuneo
address: Corso Giuseppe Mazzini, 1, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: Garibaldi's Statue, also known as Monumento a Giuseppe Garibaldi, is a significant monument in Savona, Italy. Erected in 1895 at the end of Via Paleocapa, it portrays the Italian national hero Giuseppe Garibaldi in a typical pose. The statue symbolizes his crucial role in Italy's unification and nationalism.
name: Garibaldi's Statue
address: Piazzale Eroe dei Due Mondi, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: Located along the road from Arnasco (SV) to Vendone, the sculpture park by Rainer Kriester is a notable attraction. Donated to the local community, these sculptures can be seen from the roadside and command attention with their presence over the valley. Although initially appearing eerie, they exude a sense of peacefulness and showcase unique artistic expression. The museum is well worth a visit for those interested in witnessing great art that evokes a distinct ambiance.
name: Parco delle Sculture di Rainer Kriester
address: SP35, 4, 17032 Vendone SV, Italy

detail_description: The Monumento alla Resistenza is a sculpture that commemorates the resistance movement. It stands as a symbol of bravery and defiance against oppression. The kindness of the staff and the quality of the food reflect the high standards set by this equally stunning restaurant, which is located in a picturesque setting. Overall, it comes highly recommended for its welcoming atmosphere and beautiful location.
name: Monumento alla Resistenza
address: Piazza Martiri della Libertà, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: In the vicinity of the port, you'll find Torre Corsi, a historic tower dating back to the 16th century. This ancient sea fortress also boasts other impressive towers like Torretta (Torre Leon Pancaldo), Torre del Brandale, and Guarnero. These towers served as defensive structures in the past and are reminiscent of the Asinelli towers. The straightness of these towers adds to their imposing presence.
name: Torre Corsi
address: Piazza del Brandale, 1, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: Spiaggia del Prolungamento, a hidden gem along the coast, is a delightful spot for beach lovers seeking tranquility. This stretch of sand is particularly inviting during the off-season when it transforms into a serene escape from the bustling crowds. With its natural beauty and unspoiled surroundings, visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls along the shore or simply relax under the sun.
name: Spiaggia del Prolungamento (libera solo fuori stagione)
address: Passeggiata Walter Tobagi, 7, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: Grassi Ferrero Doria Lamba Palace is a historical building with a stunning marble portal adorned with acefale figures salvaged from the demolished Palazzo Grimaldi. Inside, visitors can admire the exquisite frescoes and majolica from the renowned Savonese and Albisolese furnaces. This architectural gem was acquired by the Chamber of Commerce in 1952, adding to its rich history and significance.
name: Grassi Ferrero Doria Lamba Palace
address: Via Quarda Superiore, 16, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

name: Church S. Raffaele Al Porto
address: Piazza Pippo Rebagliati, 1, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

name: Rovere Palace
address: Via Pia, 98, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

name: Pozzobonello Palace
address: Via Quarda Superiore, 7, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: The beach of Lido Bagni Anna is a serene and well-maintained seaside retreat, with ample space between each deckchair and sun lounger. The comfortable mattresses provided add an extra element of relaxation. Guests can enjoy self-service lunches and special dinners on Saturdays, prepared by a skilled chef who consistently impresses. The attentive management of the beach by brothers Ivano and Maurizio ensures that customers are well taken care of.
name: Bagni Anna
address: Passeggiata Walter Tobagi, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

name: Monumento ai caduti del mare
address: Corso Giuseppe Garibaldi, 18013 Diano Marina IM, Italy

detail_description: Signori Arte, owned by Alessandro Signori, is an exceptional art dealer that offers a delightful shopping experience. The diligent and affable owner exhibits a deep passion for his craft, creating the foundation for outstanding customer service. Customers can expect meticulous packaging when receiving their purchased artworks. This remarkable establishment stands out for its extensive knowledge of art and its commitment to providing a pleasurable shopping environment.
name: Signori Arte di Alessandro Signori
address: Piazza Don Aragno, 7, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

detail_description: Spiaggia Libera Lo Scaletto Dei Pescatori is a popular urban beach located in the Fornaci district, close to the city center. Despite being in a big city, the area and its waters are surprisingly clean. It offers amenities such as showers and bathrooms, with accessibility for people with disabilities. The historical city center and small port add to its charm, making it worth a visit.
name: Spiaggia Libera Lo Scaletto Dei Pescatori
address: Corso Vittorio Veneto, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

name: GULLIarte
address: Via N. S. dell'Olmo, 5/7/9, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

name: Temide
address: Via dei Vacciuoli, 15 R, 17100 Savona SV, Italy

name: Fontana Del Pesce
address: Piazza Guglielmo Marconi, 1, 17100 Savona SV, Italy
